## Description {#details}

The GSYM header.

The GSYM header is found at the start of a stand alone GSYM file, or as the first bytes in a section when GSYM is contained in a section of an executable file (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf">ELF</a>, mach-o, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff">COFF</a>).

The structure is encoded exactly as it appears in the structure definition with no gaps between members. Alignment should not change from system to system as the members were laid out so that they shouldn&#39;t align differently on different architectures.

When endianness of the system loading a GSYM file matches, the file can be mmap&#39;ed in and a pointer to the header can be cast to the first bytes of the file (stand alone GSYM file) or section data (GSYM in a section). When endianness is swapped, the <a href="#a3e167f635eebf81005b8ac7290195165">Header::decode()</a> function should be used to decode the header.

Definition at line 45 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### checkForError() {#ae34d310282ea598de25cd12feb15d653}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="llvm::Error Header::checkForError () const">
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if a header is valid and return an error if anything is wrong.

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> the header and detect any errors.

This function can be used prior to encoding a header to ensure it is valid, or after decoding a header to ensure it is valid and supported.

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> a correctly byte swapped header for errors:
<ul>
<li>check magic value</li>
<li>check that version number is supported</li>
<li>check that the address offset size is supported</li>
<li>check that the <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/textapi/textstubcommon-h/#a847f9d797fd06f1d451476d6362a6a41">UUID</a> size is valid</li>
</ul>



<SectionUser title="Returns">
An error if anything is wrong in the header, or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error/#a4dfd0813c3d0e0a30439b5a3e9196b59">Error::success()</a> if there are no errors.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h/#l00101">101</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/gsym/header-cpp/#l00041">41</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/gsym/header-cpp">Header.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### BaseAddress {#af3a0fa4fd0587b1bcb2e1979bbe3c747}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::gsym::Header::BaseAddress</>}>
The 64 bit base address that all address offsets in the address offsets table are relative to.

Storing a full 64 bit address allows our address offsets table to be smaller on disk.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h/#l00062">62</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Magic {#a47ef9e8af3bae7caacb43b16108d03a1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint32&#95;t llvm::gsym::Header::Magic</>}>
The magic bytes should be set to GSYM&#95;MAGIC.

This helps detect if a file is a GSYM file by scanning the first 4 bytes of a file or section. This value might appear byte swapped

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h/#l00049">49</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### StrtabOffset {#a9f8bfadcb63e2bec5eb4e2f897e1c8f8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint32&#95;t llvm::gsym::Header::StrtabOffset</>}>
The file relative offset of the start of the string table for strings contained in the GSYM file.

If the GSYM in contained in a stand alone file this will be the file offset of the start of the string table. If the GSYM is contained in a section within an executable file, this can be the offset of the first string used in the GSYM file and can possibly span one or more executable string tables. This allows the strings to share string tables in an <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf">ELF</a> or mach-o file.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h/#l00072">72</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### StrtabSize {#aaf7da00d25cd0b1ec0e7105d1f15fcaf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint32&#95;t llvm::gsym::Header::StrtabSize</>}>
The size in bytes of the string table.

For a stand alone GSYM file, this will be the exact size in bytes of the string table. When the GSYM data is in a section within an executable file, this size can span one or more sections that contains strings. This allows any strings that are already stored in the executable file to be re-used, and any extra strings could be added to another string table and the string table offset and size can be set to span all needed string tables.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h/#l00080">80</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### UUID {#aa843b4319bce6f5a623cf632db244399}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint8&#95;t llvm::gsym::Header::UUID&#91;GSYM&#95;MAX&#95;UUID&#95;SIZE&#93;</>}>
The <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/textapi/textstubcommon-h/#a847f9d797fd06f1d451476d6362a6a41">UUID</a> of the original executable file.

This is stored to allow matching a GSYM file to an executable file when symbolication is required. Only the first &quot;UUIDSize&quot; bytes of the <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/textapi/textstubcommon-h/#a847f9d797fd06f1d451476d6362a6a41">UUID</a> are valid. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> bytes in the <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/textapi/textstubcommon-h/#a847f9d797fd06f1d451476d6362a6a41">UUID</a> value that appear after the first UUIDSize bytes should be set to zero.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h/#l00086">86</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### UUIDSize {#ae25e8b83cd8416417a33dd9267cbf4ce}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint8&#95;t llvm::gsym::Header::UUIDSize</>}>
The size in bytes of the <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/textapi/textstubcommon-h/#a847f9d797fd06f1d451476d6362a6a41">UUID</a> encoded in the &quot;UUID&quot; member.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h/#l00058">58</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Version {#a05be47ccf18c7b121da8d5e2e00c4007}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint16&#95;t llvm::gsym::Header::Version</>}>
The version can number determines how the header is decoded and how each <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/gsym/functioninfo-cpp/#a3e1eb307ada3e1ef3a115f4c734aa5ee">InfoType</a> in <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo">FunctionInfo</a> is encoded/decoded.

As version numbers increase, &quot;Magic&quot; and &quot;Version&quot; members should always appear at offset zero and 4 respectively to ensure clients figure out if they can parse the format.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h/#l00054">54</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/gsym/header-h">Header.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
